subject: Re: [junit] Anyone have experience with Confluence and jUnit?
msgSnippet: Nope Confluence. They have a jUnit macro that will embed a summary of tests in a wiki page. I am trying to get something a bit more comprehensive, such as a
messageBody:
Nope Confluence. They have a "jUnit macro" that will embed a summary of
tests in a wiki page. I am trying to get something a bit more
comprehensive, such as a test tracking system. I favor extensive tests
and am trying to get my group to do the same, but this means I need some
tool that will allow us to organize and track a large number of these
tests. My manager likes Confluence (looks pretty good for a number of
things, actually, such as jira support) but I would like to have a
broader perspective on how this product might actually work with tests.

So, anyone use Confluence?

Thanks!


Nat Pryce wrote:
>
> Confluence is an "enterprise" wiki. I don't think it has anything to
> do with JUnit.
>
> Do you mean Concordion?
>

>
> --Nat
>
> --
> http://www.natpryce.com <http://www.natpryce.com>
>
> 2009/2/23 Jeff <jjg@... <mailto:jjg%40jqhome.net>>:
> > Our group is thinking of adopting Confluence and as one of the ardent
> > jUnit testers I've been asked to investigate it.
> >
> > Does anyone have any experiences (good/bad) with it? Are there any large
> > projects that use it? Good places to get started on it?
> >
> > Thanks in Advance!
> >
> >
>
>
